packageInfo.title: Base image checks
packageInfo.description: This package is responsible for verifying the base (parent) images reported in the attestation are acceptable.

policy.release.base_image_registries.title: Base image comes from permitted registry
policy.release.base_image_registries.description: Verify that the base images used when building a container image come from a known set of trusted registries to reduce potential supply chain attacks. By default this policy defines trusted registries as registries that are fully maintained by Red Hat and only contain content produced by Red Hat. The list of permitted registries can be customized by setting the `allowed_registry_prefixes` list in the rule data.
policy.release.base_image_registries.solution: Make sure the image used in each task comes from a trusted registry. The list of trusted registries is a configurable xref:ec-cli:ROOT:configuration.adoc#_data_sources[data source].
policy.release.base_image_registries.failureMsg: Base image %q is from a disallowed registry

packageInfo.title: Base image checks
packageInfo.description: This package is responsible for verifying the base (parent) images reported in the attestation are acceptable.

policy.release.base_image_registries.title: Base image task result was provided
policy.release.base_image_registries.description: Verify the attestation provides the expected information about which base images were used during the build process. The base image information is expected to be found in a task result called BASE_IMAGES_DIGESTS.
policy.release.base_image_registries.solution: A Tekton task must exist that emits a result named BASE_IMAGES_DIGESTS.

packageInfo.title: Base image checks

policy.release.base_image_registries.title: Allowed base image registry prefixes list was provided

policy.release.base_image_registries.solution: Make sure to configure a list of trusted registries as a xref:ec-cli:ROOT:configuration.adoc#_data_sources[data source].

packageInfo.title: CVE checks
packageInfo.description: This package is responsible for verifying a CVE scan was performed during the build pipeline, and that the image under test does not contain CVEs of certain security levels.

policy.release.cve.title: Blocking CVE check
policy.release.cve.description: The SLSA Provenance attestation for the image is inspected to ensure CVEs of certain security levels have not been detected. If detected, this policy rule will fail. By default, only CVEs of critical and high security level cause a failure. This is configurable by the rule data key `restrict_cve_security_levels`. The available levels are critical, high, medium, low, and unknown.
policy.release.cve.solution: Make sure to address any CVE's related to the image. The CVEs are detected by the task that runs a Clair scan and emits a result named `CLAIR_SCAN_RESULT`.
policy.release.cve.failureMsg: Found %d CVE vulnerabilities of %s security level

packageInfo.title: CVE checks
packageInfo.description: This package is responsible for verifying a CVE scan was performed during the build pipeline, and that the image under test does not contain CVEs of certain security levels.

policy.release.cve.title: Non-blocking CVE check
policy.release.cve.description: The SLSA Provenance attestation for the image is inspected to ensure CVEs of certain security levels have not been detected. If detected, this policy rule will raise a warning. By default, the list of CVE security levels used by this policy is empty. However, this is configurable by the rule data key `warn_cve_security_levels`. The available levels are critical, high, medium, low, and unknown.
policy.release.cve.solution: Make sure to address any CVE's related to the image. The CVEs are detected by the task that runs a Clair scan and emits a result named `CLAIR_SCAN_RESULT`.
policy.release.cve.failureMsg: Found %d non-blocking CVE vulnerabilities of %s security level

packageInfo.title: CVE checks
packageInfo.description: This package is responsible for verifying a CVE scan was performed during the build pipeline, and that the image under test does not contain CVEs of certain security levels.

policy.release.cve.title: CVE scan results found
policy.release.cve.description: Confirm that clair-scan task results are present in the SLSA Provenance attestation of the build pipeline.
policy.release.cve.solution: Make sure there is a successful task in the build pipeline that runs a Clair scan and creates a task result called `CLAIR_SCAN_RESULT`.
policy.release.cve.failureMsg: Clair CVE scan results were not found

packageInfo.title: Hermetic build task
packageInfo.description: This package verifies the build task in the attestation was invoked with the expected parameters to perform a hermetic build.

policy.release.hermetic_build_task.title: Build task called with hermetic param set
policy.release.hermetic_build_task.description: Verify the build task in the PipelineRun attestation was invoked with the proper parameters to make the build process hermetic.
policy.release.hermetic_build_task.solution: Make sure the task that builds the image has a parameter named 'HERMETIC' and it's set to 'true'.
policy.release.hermetic_build_task.failureMsg: Build task was not invoked with the hermetic parameter set

packageInfo.title: Java dependency checks
packageInfo.description: This package contains a rule to confirm that all Java dependencies were rebuilt in house rather than imported directly from potentially untrusted respositories. If the result is missing no violation is reported.

policy.release.java.title: Java builds have no foreign dependencies
policy.release.java.description: The SBOM_JAVA_COMPONENTS_COUNT task result finds dependencies that have originated from foreign repositories, i.e. ones that are not rebuilt or provided by Red Hat. Verify there are no dependencies from sources not listed in the `allowed_java_component_sources` rule data.
policy.release.java.solution: Make sure there are no build dependencies that originate from foreign repositories. The allowed sources are in the rule_data under the key 'allowed_java_component_sources'.
policy.release.java.failureMsg: Found Java dependencies from '%s', expecting to find only from '%s'

packageInfo.title: Java dependency checks
packageInfo.description: This package contains a rule to confirm that all Java dependencies were rebuilt in house rather than imported directly from potentially untrusted respositories. If the result is missing no violation is reported.

policy.release.java.title: Trusted Java dependency source list was provided
policy.release.java.description: Confirm the `allowed_java_component_sources` rule data was provided, since it's required by the policy rules in this package.
policy.release.java.solution: Add a data source that contains allowable source repositories for build dependencies. The source must be located under a key named 'allowed_java_component_sources'. More information on adding xref:ec-cli:ROOT:configuration.adoc#_data_sources[data sources].

packageInfo.title: Labels
packageInfo.description: Check if the image has the expected labels set. The rules in this package distinguish file-based catalog (FBC) images from all other images. When checking an FBC image, a policy rule may use a different set of rule data. An FBC image is detected by the presence of the operators.operatorframework.io.index.configs.v1 label.

policy.release.labels.title: Deprecated labels
policy.release.labels.description: Check the image for the presence of labels that have been deprecated. Use the rule data key `deprecated_labels` to set the list of labels to check.
policy.release.labels.solution: Update the image build process to not set the deprecated labels.
policy.release.labels.failureMsg: The %q label is deprecated, replace with %q

packageInfo.title: Labels
packageInfo.description: Check if the image has the expected labels set. The rules in this package distinguish file-based catalog (FBC) images from all other images. policy.release.labels.title: Required labels
policy.release.labels.description: Check the image for the presence of labels that are required. Use the rule data `required_labels` key to set the list of labels to check, or the `fbc_required_labels` key for fbc images.
policy.release.labels.solution: Update the image build process to set the required labels.
policy.release.labels.failureMsg: The required %q label is missing. Label description: %s

packageInfo.title: Labels
packageInfo.description: Check if the image has the expected labels set. The rules in this package distinguish file-based catalog (FBC) images from all other images. When checking an FBC image, a policy rule may use a different set of rule data. An FBC image is detected by the presence of the operators.operatorframework.io.index.configs.v1 label.

policy.release.labels.title: Optional labels
policy.release.labels.description: Check the image for the presence of labels that are recommended, but not required. Use the rule data `optional_labels` key to set the list of labels to check, or the `fbc_optional_labels` key for fbc images.
policy.release.labels.solution: Update the image build process to set the optional labels.
policy.release.labels.failureMsg: The optional %q label is missing. Label description: %s

packageInfo.title: Labels
packageInfo.description: Check if the image has the expected labels set. The rules in this package distinguish file-based catalog (FBC) images from all other images. When checking an FBC image, a policy rule may use a different set of rule data. An FBC image is detected by the presence of the operators.operatorframework.io.index.configs.v1 label.

policy.release.labels.title: Disallowed inherited labels
policy.release.labels.description: Check that certain labels on the image have different values than the labels from the parent image. If the label is inherited from the parent image but not redefined for the image, it will contain an incorrect value for the image. Use the rule data `disallowed_inherited_labels` key to set the list of labels to check, or the `fbc_disallowed_inherited_labels` key for fbc images.
policy.release.labels.solution: Update the image build process to overwrite the inherited labels.
policy.release.labels.failureMsg: The %q label should not be inherited from the parent image

packageInfo.title: Olm
packageInfo.description: Checks for Operator Lifecycle Manager (OLM) bundles.

policy.release.olm.title: Unpinned images in OLM bundle
policy.release.olm.description: Check the OLM bundle image for the presence of unpinned image references. Unpinned image pull references are references to images found in link:https://osbs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/users.html#pullspec-locations[varying locations] that do not contain a digest -- uniquely identifying the version of the image being pulled.
policy.release.olm.solution: Update the OLM bundle replacing the unpinned image reference with pinned image reference. Pinned image reference contains the image digest.
policy.release.olm.failureMsg: The %q image reference is not pinned at %s.

packageInfo.title: Provenance Materials
packageInfo.description: This package provides rules for verifying the contents of the materials section of the SLSA Provenance attestation.

policy.release.provenance_materials.title: Git clone task found
policy.release.provenance_materials.description: Confirm that the attestation contains a git-clone task with `commit` and `url` task results.
policy.release.provenance_materials.solution: Make sure the build pipeline contains a task named 'git-clone'.

packageInfo.title: Provenance Materials
packageInfo.description: This package provides rules for verifying the contents of the materials section of the SLSA Provenance attestation.

policy.release.provenance_materials.title: Git clone source matches materials provenance
policy.release.provenance_materials.description: Confirm that the result of the git-clone task is included in the materials section of the SLSA provenance attestation.
policy.release.provenance_materials.solution: The build pipeline must contain a task named 'git-clone' and that task must emit results named 'url' and 'commit' and contain the clone git repository and commit, respectively.
policy.release.provenance_materials.failureMsg: Entry in materials for the git repo %q and commit %q not found

packageInfo.title: Red Hat manifests

policy.release.redhat_manifests.title: Missing Red Hat manifests
policy.release.redhat_manifests.description: Verify the expected Red Hat manifests are available in the image.

packageInfo.title: SLSA - Build - Build Service
packageInfo.description:
The SLSA requirement states the following:
"All build steps ran using some build service, not on a developers workstation."
This package verifies the requirement by asserting the image was built by Tekton Pipelines.

policy.release.slsa_build_build_service.title: SLSA Builder ID found
policy.release.slsa_build_build_service.description: Verify that the attestation attribute predicate.builder.id is set.
policy.release.slsa_build_build_service.solution: The builder id in the attestation is missing. Make sure the build system is setting the build id when generating an attestation.
policy.release.slsa_build_build_service.failureMsg: Builder ID not set in attestation

packageInfo.title: SLSA - Build - Build Service
packageInfo.description:
The SLSA requirement states the following:
"All build steps ran using some build service, not on a developers workstation."
This package verifies the requirement by asserting the image was built by Tekton Pipelines.

policy.release.slsa_build_build_service.title: SLSA Builder ID is known and accepted
policy.release.slsa_build_build_service.description: Verify that the attestation attribute predicate.builder.id is set to one of the values in the `allowed_builder_ids` rule data, e.g. "https://tekton.dev/chains/v2".
policy.release.slsa_build_build_service.solution: Make sure the build id is set to an expected value. The expected values are set in the xref:ec-cli:ROOT:configuration.adoc#_data_sources[data sources].

packageInfo.title: SLSA - Build - Scripted Build
packageInfo.description:
The SLSA requirement states the following:
"All build steps were fully defined in some sort of build script. The only manual command, if any, was to invoke the build script."
This package verifies the requirement by asserting the image was built by Tekton Pipelines.

policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.title: Build task contains steps
policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.description: Verify that the predicate.buildConfig.tasks.steps attribute for the task responsible for building and pushing the image is not empty.
policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.solution: There were no build tasks detected. Make sure the build pipeline contains tasks and that the build system is recording them properly when the attestation is generated.
policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.failureMsg: Build task %q does not contain any steps

packageInfo.title: SLSA - Build - Scripted Build
packageInfo.description:
The SLSA requirement states the following:
"All build steps were fully defined in some sort of build script. The only manual command, if any, was to invoke the build script."
This package verifies the requirement by asserting the image was built by Tekton Pipelines.

policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.title: Build task set image digest and url task results
policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.description: Confirm that a build task exists and it has the expected IMAGE_DIGEST and IMAGE_URL task results.
policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.solution: Make sure the build pipeline contains a build task. The build task must contain results named 'IMAGE_DIGEST' and 'IMAGE_URL'.

packageInfo.title: SLSA - Build - Scripted Build
packageInfo.description:
The SLSA requirement states the following:
"All build steps were fully defined in some sort of build script. The only manual command, if any, was to invoke the build script."
This package verifies the requirement by asserting the image was built by Tekton Pipelines.

policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.title: Provenance subject matches build task image result
policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.description: Verify the subject of the attestations matches the IMAGE_DIGEST and IMAGE_URL values from the build task.
policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.solution: Make sure the subject in the attestation matches the 'IMAGE_URL' and 'IMAGE_DIGEST' results from the build task. The format for the subject should be 'IMAGE_URL@IMAGE_DIGEST'.
policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.failureMsg: The attestation subject, %q, does not match the build task image, %q

packageInfo.title: SLSA - Provenance - Available
packageInfo.description:
The SLSA Provenance Available requirement states the following:
"The provenance is available to the consumer in a format that the consumer accepts. The format SHOULD be in-toto SLSA Provenance, but another format MAY be used if both producer and consumer agree and it meets all the other requirements."
This package only accepts the in-toto SLSA Provenance format.

policy.release.slsa_provenance_available.title: Expected attestation predicate type found
policy.release.slsa_provenance_available.description: Verify that the predicateType field of the attestation indicates the in-toto SLSA Provenance format was used to attest the PipelineRun.
policy.release.slsa_provenance_available.solution: The predicate type field in the attestation does not match the 'allowed_predicate_types' field. This field is set in the xref:ec-cli:ROOT:configuration.adoc#_data_sources[data sources].
policy.release.slsa_provenance_available.failureMsg: Attestation predicate type %q is not an expected type (%s)

packageInfo.title: SLSA - Source - Version Controlled
packageInfo.description:
The SLSA requirement states the following:
"Every change to the source is tracked in a version control system that meets the following requirements:

  [Change history] There exists a record of the history of changes
  that went into the revision. Each change must contain: the
  identities of the uploader and reviewers (if any), timestamps of
  the reviews (if any) and submission, the change
  description/justification, the content of the change, and the
  parent revisions.

  [Immutable reference] There exists a way to indefinitely reference
  this particular, immutable revision. In git, this is the {repo URL +
  branch/tag/ref + commit ID}.

Most popular version control system meet this requirement, such as git, Mercurial, Subversion, or Perforce."
This package verifies the requirement by asserting the image was built from a git repository.

policy.release.slsa_source_version_contr.title: Materials have uri and digest
policy.release.slsa_source_version_contr.description: Confirm at least one entry in the predicate.materials array of the attestation contains the expected attributes: uri and digest.sha1.
policy.release.slsa_source_version_contr.solution: Make sure the attestation contains the repository URI and digest.sha1. This information comes from the 'CHAINS-GIT_URL' and 'CHAINS-GIT_COMMIT' results in the 'git-clone' task.

packageInfo.title: Tasks
packageInfo.description: Enterprise Contract expects that a set of tasks were included in the pipeline build for each image to be released. This package includes a set of rules to verify that the expected tasks ran in the pipeline when the image was built. Required tasks are listed by the names given to them within the Tekton Bundle image. Optionally invocation parameter of a Task can be also mandated by including the name and the value in square brackets following the name of the task. For example: ``name[PARAM=val]``. Only single parameter is supported, to assert multiple parameters repeat the required task definition for each parameter seperately.

releaseCollections.title: slsa2
releaseCollections.description: Includes policy rules required to meet SLSA Level 2. Special attention must be given to two requirements which are not covered by the policy rules in this collection. The first is "Provenance - Authenticated" which is expected to be performed when fetching the attestation via cosign or ec-cli. The second requirement is "Provenance - Service Generated" which is a little more complex to verify. By meeting both the "Provenance - Authenticated" AND "Build - Build Service" requirements, we can have some confidence that this requirement is met since Chains is a service that generates signed attestations with data obtained from the build service (Tekton Pipelines).

releaseCollections.description: Includes policy rules required to meet SLSA Level 3. This is currently a work in progress and functionally the same as the slsa2 collection.

rules.title: SLSA Builder ID is known and accepted
Build task set image digest and url task results
Provenance subject matches build task image result
Material uri is a git repo
Pipeline run includes at least one task

policy.pipeline.basic.title: Pipeline definition sanity checks
policy.pipeline.basic.description: Policies to confirm the Tekton Pipeline definition has the expected kind.

policy.pipeline.required_tasks.title: Required tasks
policy.pipeline.required_tasks.description: RHTAP expects that certain Tekton tasks are executed during image builds. This package includes policy rules to confirm that the pipeline definition includes those required tasks.

policy.pipeline.task_bundle.title: Task bundle
policy.pipeline.task_bundle.description: To be able to reproduce and audit builds accurately it's important to know exactly what happens during the build. To do this Enterprise Contract requires that all tasks are defined in a set of known and trusted task bundles. This package includes rules to confirm that the tasks in a Pipeline definition are defined in task bundles, and that the task bundles are from the list of known and trusted bundles.

policy.release.attestation_type.title: Attestation type
policy.release.attestation_type.description: Sanity checks related to the format of the image build's attestation.

policy.release.base_image_registries.title: Base image checks
policy.release.base_image_registries.description: This package is responsible for verifying the base (parent) images reported in the attestation are acceptable.

policy.release.buildah_build_task.title: Buildah build task
policy.release.buildah_build_task.description: This package is responsible for verifying the buildah build task

policy.release.builtin.attestation.title: Builtin attestation policies
policy.release.builtin.attestation.description: This package is responsible for validating attestation signature and syntax. Note that builtin policies are always included and cannot be skipped regardless of your policy.

policy.release.builtin.image.title: Builtin image policies
policy.release.builtin.image.description: This package is responsible for validating image signature. Note that builtin policies are always included and cannot be skipped regardless of your policy configuration.

policy.release.cve.title: CVE checks
policy.release.cve.description: This package is responsible for verifying a CVE scan was performed during the build pipeline, and that the image under test does not contain CVEs of certain security levels.

policy.release.external_parameters.title: External parameters
policy.release.external_parameters.description: Verify the attribute .predicate.buildDefinition.externalParameters of a SLSA Provenance v1.0 matches the expectation.

policy.release.github_certificate.title: GitHub Certificate Checks
policy.release.github_certificate.description: Verify attributes on the certificate involved in the image signature when using slsa-github-generator on GitHub Actions with Sigstore Fulcio

policy.release.hermetic_build_task.title: Hermetic build task
policy.release.hermetic_build_task.description: This package verifies the build task in the attestation was invoked with the expected parameters to perform a hermetic build.

policy.release.java.title: Java dependency checks
policy.release.java.description: This package contains a rule to confirm that all Java dependencies were rebuilt in house rather than imported directly from potentially untrusted respositories. If the result is missing no violation is reported.

policy.release.labels.title: Labels
policy.release.labels.description: Check if the image has the expected labels set. The rules in this package distinguish file-based catalog (FBC) images from all other images. When checking an FBC image, a policy rule may use a different set of rule data. An FBC image is detected by the presence of the operators.operatorframework.io.index.configs.v1 label.

policy.release.olm.title: Olm
policy.release.olm.description: Checks for Operator Lifecycle Manager (OLM) bundles.

policy.release.provenance_materials.title: Provenance Materials
policy.release.provenance_materials.description: This package provides rules for verifying the contents of the materials section of the SLSA Provenance attestation.

policy.release.redhat_manifests.title: Red Hat manifests
policy.release.redhat_manifests.description: Red Hat images are expected to include certain manifest files. This package verifies this requirement is met.

policy.release.slsa_build_build_service.title: SLSA - Build - Build Service
policy.release.slsa_build_build_service.description:
The SLSA requirement states the following:
"All build steps ran using some build service, not on a developers workstation."
This package verifies the requirement by asserting the image was built by Tekton Pipelines.

policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.title: SLSA - Build - Scripted Build
policy.release.slsa_build_scripted_build.description:
The SLSA requirement states the following:
"All build steps were fully defined in some sort of build script. The only manual command, if any, was to invoke the build script."
This package verifies the requirement by asserting the image was built by Tekton Pipelines.

policy.release.slsa_provenance_available.title: SLSA - Provenance - Available
policy.release.slsa_provenance_available.description:
The SLSA Provenance Available requirement states the following:
"The provenance is available to the consumer in a format that the consumer accepts. The format SHOULD be in-toto SLSA Provenance, but another format MAY be used if both producer and consumer agree and it meets all the other requirements."
This package only accepts the in-toto SLSA Provenance format.

policy.release.slsa_source_version_contr.title: SLSA - Source - Version Controlled
policy.release.slsa_source_version_contr.description:
The SLSA requirement states the following:
"Every change to the source is tracked in a version control system that meets the following requirements:

  [Change history] There exists a record of the history of changes
  that went into the revision. Each change must contain: the
  identities of the uploader and reviewers (if any), timestamps of
  the reviews (if any) and submission, the change
  description/justification, the content of the change, and the
  parent revisions.

  [Immutable reference] There exists a way to indefinitely reference
  this particular, immutable revision. In git, this is the {repo URL +
  branch/tag/ref + commit ID}.

Most popular version control system meet this requirement, such as git, Mercurial, Subversion, or Perforce."
This package verifies the requirement by asserting the image was built from a git repository.

policy.release.slsa_source_correlated.title: SLSA - Verification model - Source
policy.release.slsa_source_correlated.description:
SLSA v1 verification model states:
"...artifacts are verified to ensure they meet the producer defined expectations of where the package source code was retrieved from..."
This package correlates the provided source code reference with the source code referenced in the attestation.

policy.release.sbom_spdx.title: Sbom spdx
policy.release.sbom_spdx.description: Checks different properties of the SPDX SBOM attestation.

policy.release.schedule.title: Schedule related checks
policy.release.schedule.description: Rules that verify the current date conform to a given schedule.

policy.release.step_image_registries.title: Step image registries
policy.release.step_image_registries.description: This package contains a rule to ensure that each task in the image's build pipeline ran using a container image from a known and presumably trusted source.

policy.release.attestation_task_bundle.title: Task bundle checks
policy.release.attestation_task_bundle.description: To be able to reproduce and audit builds accurately it's important to know exactly what happened during the build. To do this Enterprise Contract requires that all tasks are defined in a set of known and trusted task bundles. This package includes rules to confirm that the tasks that built the image were defined in task bundles, and that the task bundles used are from the list of known and trusted bundles.

policy.release.tasks.title: Tasks
policy.release.tasks.description: Enterprise Contract expects that a set of tasks were included in the pipeline build for each image to be released. This package includes a set of rules to verify that the expected tasks ran in the pipeline when the image was built. Required tasks are listed by the names given to them within the Tekton Bundle image. Optionally invocation parameter of a Task can be also mandated by including the name and the value in square brackets following the name of the task. For example: ``name[PARAM=val]``. Only single parameter is supported, to assert multiple parameters repeat the required task definition for each parameter seperately.

policy.release.test.title: Test
policy.release.test.description: Enterprise Contract requires that each build was subjected to a set of tests and that those tests all passed. This package includes a set of rules to verify that.
